line.en: 'Wow, that was such a pretty photo, wasn't it?'
'...Yes, it was.'
'Oh, are you feeling cranky, Akari?'
'Hmm? No, not at all.'
'Kotori appeared just as you were about to bring\ndown a rain of pain upon them!'
'They just thought that you were a nagging, angry\nkind of person, didn't they, Akari?'
'You don't need to sound so happy about it. I'm\nthe one who accepted this thankless task.'
'I'm the only one who understands you, isn't that\nright, Akari-chan?'
'...Thanks. Now could you let go of me?'
'It's not that I'm in a bad mood or anything.\n...It's just that I've been thinking.'
'Hey, Kanako.'
'Yeah?'
'That transfer student... Who is he?'
'Hmm? He's the dorm mother.'
'Dorm mother...?'
'Yeah. He's a nice guy. Why, have you fallen for\nhim?'
'D...don't be ridiculous!'
'He's only just transferred here, but he can\nalready handle the antisocial Mochizuki-senpai so\nwell...'
'...I just thought he was very astute, that's\nall.'
'Are you praising him?'
'Huh'
Having reached the number of members needed for\nthe club, the vice president left the garage.
Together with Kanako.
The rest of us continued to look at the\nphotograph that Kotori had brought.
'Such a beautiful sky...'
'But these clouds are a very unusual shape.'
'Yeah, I've never seen clouds like this before.'
'Me neither. These clouds appeared before you or\nI were born.'
'Before we were born...?'
'What on earth is this photograph?'
It was really beautiful.

However, it was the same as the pictures in old
photo albums. The sort that you would take to the
photo shop to have developed, and was printed on
paper with logos on the back.
'This phenomenon is known as 'Morning Glory'. It\nonly occurs under certain conditions.'
'Morning Glory...?'
'It's a path of clouds in the sky, several\nkilometers long.'
'A path of clouds like this, several kilometers\nlong...'
'It's a very rare phenomenon; the most recent\noccurrence was 26 years ago.'
'The members of the Soaring Club at the time,\nflew in the glider, and took this photograph.'
'Wow... so, that means...'
'This photo was taken in Kazegaura!?'
'Yes, it was.'
'Did an older member of the club take the photo?'
'Yes, that's right.'

To think that this amazing spectacle occurred
right here, in my hometown, and that the person
who took the photograph was a member of the club
I'm in.
Even though I'm getting a lot closer to the thing\nthat I thought was so distant, it still doesn't\nseem real somehow.
I think that I felt something along the lines of\n'Dude, that's amazing'.
'...Hold on a sec!'
She looked like she was about to say 'I've just\nrealized something really important!
'What is it?'
'Did you just say that... they took this photo\nfrom the glider?'
'Yes, I did. That's what it says in the flight\nlog.'
'So that means...'
Ageha and I take another look at the photograph.
If you wanted to take a photograph from this\nperspective, the camera would have to be in a\nposition higher than the clouds.
'Did the glider actually fly this high?'
'Well, yes. The physical evidence is right there\nin front of you.'
Ageha and I turn to look at the white aircraft.

I don't know how many meters up that was, but
when I actually picture this flying above the
clouds, it seems kind of unreliable. It wasn't
just my imagination.

'The Soaring Club had already lost its status as
a club when I first arrived at this school. All
that was left was the equipment that you see
here.'
'This photograph was among what was left here...'
Amane takes the photograph in her hand, and\nsquints her eyes nostalgically.
'This is where Isuka wanted to go.'
'Isuka and I wanted to go to this place. That's\nwhy we started constructing the glider.'
...Isuka.
There's that name again.
Whenever Amane says that name, she becomes very\nwistful.
Who is this Isuka person?
'Umm, here...'
While we were talking, Kotori was listening\nquietly. But now, she's holding out a notebook to\nAmane.
I thought I had seen it before: it was the\nnotebook with the 'Things I want to do' list.
'The photo was inside this.'
'This is... Isuka's flight log. Why do you have\nthis?'
'It was at the dormitory, in my room.'
'The dormitory... in your room...'
'...Are you by any chance living in the Flying\nFish Manor?'
A little surprised to hear that name all of a\nsudden, Kotori nodded.
'It was hidden in a gap between the shelves...'
'It's like a diary inside. There are things about\nthe glider... and about you written in it.'
'Me?'
'Yes... maybe. You're Isuka's close friend,\naren't you?'
For some reason, Amane didn't answer. She just\nlooked at the worn cover of the notebook.
'Reading this is what got me interested in\ngliders.'
'Using only its wings, it uses the wind to fly\nacross the sky, an aircraft that is just like a\nbird...'
'To aim to fly above the clouds in something like\nthat... I thought that was amazing.'

'But I thought it was much further back in the
past. When I looked at the dates, I thought that
Isuka and the others must have graduated
already.'
'...I didn't think that it would still be going\non now.'
'But if you were interested in gliders, why\ndidn't you come to check out the Soaring Club?'
I asked in a lighthearted manner.
Actually, she was so interested in them that just\nlooking at a real glider makes her eyes sparkle\nwith wonder.
The owner of the diary might no longer be around\nthough.
'That's, well...'
Kotori held tightly to the hem of her skirt.
'...I didn't think they'd let me join.'
'Kotori...'
Listening to her words, I felt a dull pain coming\nfrom my right knee.
Somewhere that she couldn't enter...
That's what she believed, and that's why she\ndidn't try to find out about the current status\nof the Soaring Club.
It might have been similar to how I tried to\navoid hearing any information about the Cycle\nRacing Club after I injured my knee.
The more I knew, the more envious I would become.
'That's why I was surprised when I saw the glider\nflying over Windmill Hill.'
'I was so excited. I could feel my heart\npounding.'
That was the time that Kotori and I first met.
In that peaceful landscape, Kotori watched the\nwhite aircraft flying overhead with such\nenthusiasm.
'Really...?'
When Amane heard Kotori's story, she took a deep\nbreath.
'Can I take a look?'
'Yeah...'
Amane put the book on the table, but didn't read\nit straight away. Instead, she went to boil some\nwater in the electric kettle first.
Then, she prepared the tea set.
When the pleasant aroma of the tea started to\nfill the air, Amane sat down and finally turned\nto the first page.
Her cheeks went slightly pink, and her eyes\nseemed kind of nervous.
Amane's eyes move from left to right across the\npage.
Slowly, carefully.
It looked like she was digesting it one letter at\na time.
She took a sip of the hot tea.
She placed the cup back on the saucer, and then\nturned to the next page.
'Hee hee...'
She began to smile.
Maybe something fun was written there.
She giggled as if she had become lost in\nmemories.
The nervousness that was in her eyes when reading\nthe first page had disappeared.
'She's smiling...'
'Yeah.'
It was a calm, happy smile.
Or so we thought...
Then, looking at the next page, she opened her\neyes wide.
There must be something surprising written on\nthat page.
She continued to read, looking surprised.
Amane's expression continued to change as she\nturned the pages.
She smiled, then seemed surprised, then looked\ntroubled, then appeared to be sulking, and then\nsmiled again.
'...Hey, what kind of things are written in\nthere?'
'It's a record of the Soaring Club's activities.\n...Well, I say that, but most of it is just a\nnormal diary.'
'It's about how Isuka spent every day with her\n'best friend.' It's written in really bad\nhandwriting, so it's hard to read.'
'Amane's best friend, huh...? I wonder what sort\nof person Isuka is?'
'Strange, probably.'
'Playing tricks on people, and surprising them.\nThrowing pies in the dormitory dining hall...'
'But, when you read it, it had an effect on you,\ndidn't it?'
'...Yeah.'
'...It seemed really fun.'
We could tell by the look on Amane's face that\nIsuka's flight log was full of funny stories.
It was also proof that the time they spent\ntogether was equally fun.
When she reached what was probably the last page\nof the diary...
Amane had tears in her eyes.
As Amane smiled nostalgically, a clear drop ran\ndown from the corner of her squinted eye.
'I wonder if something sad was written in\nthere...?'
'But she's smiling...'
'The log stops halfway through. The last thing\nthat was written in there was...'
'...'Things I want to do''
The page that we were looking at?
'I want to pass through the passage of\nclouds'...'
Amane mumbled in a quiet voice, before bursting\ninto tears...
...while still smiling.
She must have been smiling because she was happy.
Then the tears must have been because it was all\nin the past.
Just looking at her made me feel a terrible pain\ninside, like my chest was closing up.
After reading the last page, she closed the\nnotebook, and then went back to the first page.
This is the third time, now.
Even so, she reads it as if for the first time,\nwith the same happiness, surprise, worry, and\nnostalgia.
We quietly watched her as she repeated this again\nand again.
The tea that she has only taken one sip from is\ndefinitely cold by now. But, it seems like she\nhas totally forgotten about it.
'...Looks like we have no choice but to leave her\nto it for now.'
'...You're right.'
There are so many things I want to talk to her\nabout, but it doesn't feel like now is a good\ntime to speak.
As we leave the garage, the sky is filled with\nthe colors of sunset.
With a deeper red than sunrise, the darkness of\nnight approached from the eastern sky.
'The photo of the clouds was really pretty,\nwasn't it?'
'Yeah.'
'Will we go to that place?'
Ageha seemed to be saying 'I'm itching to go!
I felt the same way.
'Well then, I'm just gonna go and show my face at\nthe Robotics Club.'
'Even though I'm a member of both clubs, I don't\ngo there every day.'
'You don't seem that busy either, it should be\nOK.'
Even if she is also in another club, it's great\nthat she's here.
'Sorry for all the trouble.'
'No, it's fine, buddy!'
BAM!
Ageha gives me a punch in the shoulder, and turns\nround to Kotori, who had left a little later, but\nwas following us.
'Kotori...'
'I'm sorry about yesterday!'
PAH!
Ageha bowed her head with great momentum.
'I-It's fine, I don't think you have anything to\napologize for.'
'I didn't know about your situation. Despite\nthat, I spoke to you as if I knew what was going\non.'
'I'm really sorry.'
Kotori glanced at me.
She must have realized that I had told Ageha\nabout her wanting to quit school, and so on.
'Hmph. I'm glad you realize that.'
Kotori turns her head sideways in an aloof manner\nas she speaks.
I storm over towards Kotori and...
Whack.
'Ouch!'
'Whoa!'
I gave her a karate chop to the top of her head.
'What are you doing!?'
'From now on, every time you take on that kind of\nattitude, I'm gonna give you a chop.'
'Huuuh!?'
Kotori reeled back.
Then, she looked at me with eyes like a demon or\nan ogre.
'What gives you the right to do that...!?'
'C'mon now, you've got something to say, don't\nyou?'
'I'm sorry... I said too much, too.'
'You don't kiss up to people. You're just... kind\nto the point of it being annoying.'
'Anno...'
Whack.
'Argh!?'
'Hey! That hurts, you know!!'
'If it didn't hurt, you wouldn't remember.'

She looked at me with anger in her eyes as she
rubbed the top of her head. She did that
sideways-aloof-face thing, and pushed her
wheelchair along.
'Bleeegh!'
'...Wow, Aoi. I can't believe you could karate\nchop a pretty little girl like Kotori.'
Ageha is a little stunned as she speaks.
'Well then, I'm off now. You'd better go after\nKotori.'
'Yeah. See ya.'
'See you!'
Ageha, who looks like she's skipping as she\nwalks, turns to head towards the school building.
But, she stopped halfway...
'It looks like things will be interesting from\ntomorrow!'
she called out, in a big voice.
I caught up with Kotori. She had a meek\nexpression on her face as she quietly pushed her\nwheelchair along.
'Want me to push you?'
'No.'

I don't know how tiring it is to push a
wheelchair along. But, if I tried to travel the
same distance I would normally walk by using my
hands, I would definitely find it tiring.
I went behind her and pushed the wheelchair.
'I said I don't want you push me.'
'I told you that I'd help you, didn't I?'
'I'm not gonna do it all the time, but when my\nhands are empty, you can rely on me.'
'...But there's no reason for you do that for\nme.'
'Yes there is.'
'...What's that then?'
'Because we're friends.'
I felt a little embarrassed as I said that.
I don't think I'd have been able to say that if I\nhadn't been behind her.
'Since when... h-have we been friends?'
'Yesterday, we were hanging out, weren't we? That\nmeans we're already friends, right?'
Generally speaking, it would be correct to say\nso.
Kotori stays tight-lipped and doesn't answer.
For a while, we don't say anything as we follow\nthe route back.
'...Aren't you going to ask me? Why I... decided\nto stay?'
'...I don't know if I want to ask or not. What\nmatters is the fact that you are staying.'
'That withdrawal notice... Could you hold onto it\nfor a little while longer?'
'...Sure.'
So she's not going to throw it away?
'...To me, this place is like the last bastion.'
'I don't know if I can stay here indefinitely\nlike Amane... But, I want to stay a little\nlonger.'
'But sometimes I lose heart. I may not look like\nit, but I have a lot of worries.'
It seems like she's trying to say 'I may be a\ntough girl but...
'(You just look like a crybaby!)'
If I said that, she'd just get mad, so I keep\nquiet.
'That's why I want you to hold onto it... Would\nthat be OK?'
She suddenly seemed to lose her resolve, and she\nturns around to glance at me.
...Why me?
That question comes to mind, but I don't say\nanything.
I think the fact that it was me makes me quite\nhappy, to be honest.
'That's fine, but I have one condition.'
'Wh-What?'
Kotori puts her guard up.
She looks as though she thinks I have another\ncrazy demand to make.
'You talk to me like I'm a stranger. I want you\nto use my name more.'
'Huh?'
'You always refer to me as 'you' or 'him', but I\nwant you to call me 'Aoi.' We're friends now.'
'Hmmm...'
'...Would that be a problem? Don't you think of\nme as your friend?'
I'm a little anxious as I ask her.
'No, that's not it! It's just... that you... no,\nI mean... umm...'
'See?'
'She seemed to say 'It seems weird! Please\nunderstand!', as she bent forward.
'Kotori, why do you find it so strange to say my\nname?'
'We don't know each other well enough to be on a\nfirst name basis!'
'Well, never mind. C'mon, let's go, 'Miss\nHabane'.'
'...It's OK... I don't mind if you call me\nKotori.'
'OK, let's go, Kotori.'
Kotori had a look on her face that indicated\nancomplex mix of emotions. It seemed awkward and\nshy at the same time.
'We'll definitely go there, above the clouds.'
'Yeah...'
There are wispy clouds in the sunset sky.
From now on, whenever we look up at the sky,\nwe'll be thinking about this.
...I'm gonna fly!
My heart was beating frighteningly quickly.
'...you want to pass through the passage of\nclouds, huh?'
'That's what you always said, Isuka.'
'...It's dark. When did it become nighttime?'
Clatter.
'...My tea's gone cold.'
'Has everyone...gone home...?'
'...I didn't think I would be able to continue\nhere.'
'Isuka... You reached them, didn't you? You\nbrought them here.'
It looks like I can keep going.
Just a little longer, until the end of this\nsummer...
